translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .🔽The Group of Fives
The Elder Nun Sīhā’s Verses
Because of inappropriate attention,
I was tormented by lustful desire.
In the past I was restless,
not in control of my mind.
I was overcome by defilements,
following the perception of beauty;
I did not attain mental tranquility,
following a mind full of lust.
I became thin, pale, and haggard,
and wandered for seven years.

analyzed: na aham divā vā rattim vā
translated: Day and night,
I did not find happiness, being very unhappy.
Then, taking a rope,
I entered the forest.
It would be better for me to hang myself here

analyzed: yat ca hīnam punar ācare  daḷha pāsam karitvāna  rukkha sākhāya
translated: than to live a low life again.🔽Making a strong noose,🔽and tying it to a tree branch,
I put the noose around my neck,
and then my mind was liberated.”
… the elder nun Sīhā …
